text.0: your radiant chariotwhither goes it on its waywho decks it for you heroes for its happy course.
text.1: starting at daybreak visiting each morning every house borne hitherward through prayer unto the sacrifice.
text.2: where are ye aśvins in the evening where at morn where is your haltingplace where rest ye for the night.
text.3: who brings you homeward as the widow bedward draws her husbands brother as the bride attracts the groom.
text.4: early ye sing forth praise as with a heralds voice and meet for worship go each morning to the house.
text.5: whom do ye ever bring to ruin unto whose libations come ye heroes like two sons of kings.
text.6: even as hunters follow two wild elephants we with oblations call you down at morn and eve.
text.7: to folk who pay you offierings at appointed times chiefs lords of splendour ye bring food to strengthen them.
text.8: to you o aśvins came the daughter of a king ghoṣā and said o heroes this i beg of you.
text.9: be near me in the day he near me in the night help me to gain a carborne chieftain rich in steeds.
text.10: o aśvins ye are wise as kutsa comes to men bring your car nigh the folk of him who sings your praise.
text.11: the bee o aśvins bears your honey in her mouth as the maid carries it purified in her hand.
text.12: to bhujyu and to vaśa ye come near with help o aśvins to sinjara and to uśanā.
text.13: your worshipper secures your friendship for himself through your protection i desire felicity.
text.14: krsa and Śayu ye protect ye aśvins twain ye two assist the widow and the worshipper.
text.15: and ye throw open aśvins unto those who win the cattlestall that thunders with its serenfold mouth.
text.16: the woman hath brought forth the infant hath appeared the plants of wondrous beauty straightway have sprung up.
text.17: to him the rivers run as down a deep descent and he this day becomes their master and their lord.
text.18: they mourn the living cry aloud at sacrifice the men have set their thoughts upon a distant cast.
text.19: a lovely thing for fathers who have gathered herea joy to husbandsare the wives their arms shall clasp.
text.20: of this we have no knowledge tall it forth to us now the youth rests within the chambers of the bride.
text.21: fain would we reach the dwelling of the vigorous steer who loves the kine o aśvins this is our desire.
text.22: your favouring grace hath come ye lords of ample wealth aśvins our longings are stored up within your hearts.
text.23: ye lords of splendour have become our twofold guard may we as welcome friends reach aryamans abode.
text.24: even so rejoicing in the dwellingplace of man give hero sons and riches to the eloquent.
text.25: make a ford lords of splendour where men well may drink remove the spiteful treestump standing in the path.
text.26: o aśvins wonderworkers lords of lustre where and with what folk do ye delight yourselves today.
text.27: who hath detained them with him whither are they gone unto what sages or what worshippers abode.
